issue.title: <=> for integer-class types isn't consistently specified

discussion.p:
It seems that the return type of <=> for integer-class types is not specified consistently with other comparison operators. Even has ignored it.
IMO strong_ordering should be added to /(5.3), and three_way_comparable<strong_ordering> should be added to /8.
The upcoming revision will provide additional wording to solve this issue.
Set priority to 3 after reflector poll. Tentatively Resolved by which has been approved by LWG.
discussion.note: 2021-10-23 Resolved by the adoption of at the October 2021 plenary. Status changed: Tentatively Resolved → Resolved.
